title: Farmer Risk Perception During 2019 Midwest Drought
abstract: Survey-based study examining how agricultural producers in Iowa, Illinois, and Missouri perceived and responded to drought risk during the 2019 growing season. Includes demographic data, risk perception scales, and behavioral response measures.
purpose: To understand how farmers' risk perceptions influence drought preparedness and adaptation strategies, informing agricultural extension services and policy development
creator: Dr. Sarah Martinez, Iowa State University
citation_recommendation: Martinez, S., Chen, M., & Rodriguez, J. (2019). Farmer Risk Perception During 2019 Midwest Drought. Iowa State University. https://doi.org/10.5555/drought-perception-2019
geographic_coverage_specific: Agricultural counties in Iowa, Illinois, and Missouri
collection_methodology: Mail survey with phone follow-up, stratified random sampling of farm operators from USDA Census of Agriculture lists
uncertainty_quantification: 95% confidence intervals provided for all estimates; response rate 34% with non-response bias analysis included
data_processing: Data cleaning included outlier detection, missing data imputation using multiple imputation, survey weights calculated for population inference
provenance: Raw surveys collected May-October 2019, coded and cleaned November 2019-February 2020, final dataset released June 2020
integration_with_other_data: Can be linked to USDA crop yield data, NOAA drought monitor data, and crop insurance records via county FIPS codes and time periods
software_dependencies: R 4.0+, SPSS 26+, survey package for R
access_restrictions: Academic use only, requires data use agreement
retention_policy: Available for 20 years through Iowa State University Digital Repository with migration guarantee
